title: Brightcove-hosted videos ceased to play with Firefox 89 and possibly some prior versions
content:
Hello,

I've been a Firefox user for about as long as it has existed, maybe a year or, at most, two less, but Firefox 89 and maybe one or two of the preceding versions ceased to be able to download and, therefore, play videos that some people have hosted on the Brightcove platform. The video at the top of the following page is one of many examples at the Web site: https://www.meteomedia.com/ca/nouvelles/article/quebec-prochaine-victime-du-dome-de-chaleur. I also got the same error at a wholly different Web site yesterday or the day before, so right- or left-clicked the mouse at the bottom of the frame for the player, or just above it but still over the player's frame, and was able to see that the video was also hosted at Brightcove.

I get two error messages and the first one, shown in its own frame says, "No video has been loaded" and "Error Code: PLAYER_ERR_NO_SRC", both shown at the same time within the same window sort of frame. I then click to close that inner frame and get NOTHING ; nothing being shown for any message and there's just a spinning wheel, permitting to see that nothing is being downloaded or loaded for the player to have something to play.

I have no problems with videos at YouTube and haven't tried at other video hosting Web sites, having formerly known of one but having forgotten what it is. It's quite known and I just don't recall the domain name. So, I'm unable to test trying with other hosting sites. Well, I tried to find some using only "videos" for search and got a link for the following article, "12 Video Sites That Are Better Than YouTube", by Dan Price, 30 April 2021, https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/top-12-sites-watch-videos-youtube. #1 is vimeo and vimeo.com isn't at all loading correctly with Firefox 89 (89.0.1). #2 is Metacafe, while #3 is DailyMotion, and the videos at both of these Web sites play, though the quality of the image isn't at all as good at YouTube, not with the 3 videos I tried anyway. (Maybe it's just that the functionality of these "better than YouTube" Web sites is better, for YouTube maintainers have definitely damaged its functionality, but this isn't a problem for Mozilla to resolve.)

So, for now, the problem I'm having appears to only be with videos hosted at Brightcove. I've been using MeteoMedia.com for many years and it's only some months ago that their videos ceased to load and therefore play. And I'm sure to recall having checked the videos at MM a number of times over years, clicking on the player in the same manner and seeing that Brightcove was being used, with the videos playing correctly every time, until earlier this year, 2021.

Mike/Michel Corbeil Quebec, Canada
creator: mikecorbeil

title: Interactive PDF Firefox 89
content:
I am currently working with interactive PDF forms using Acrobat DC. These PDF files are stored locally. I have tested the same PDF in Chrome, Edge and Acrobat Reader and they all function as intended. I originally thought it may be a security issue and have spent the last two days following the development of Firefox 55 - 88. Firefox does allow PDF content to be written and saved locally. Firefox does not allow me to alter visibility states of components using JavaScript Firefox does not allow me to fill text fields with strings using JavaScript. Chrome, Edge and Acrobat Reader allow all of the above.

I have ensured that pdfjs.renderInteractiveForms has been set to true.

Does anybody know if there are additional settings - or any ideas?

title: Screen Appearance
content:
I am using version 88.01 (64 Bit) on the machine that I am typing on. I have always used default settings for screen appearance and colors (Default Theme using system colors). When I upgraded to 89.0 on this machine the appearance of web pages changed. The menu bar color went from a deep blue to a light gray and I don't like it. Simply put, I like the contrast. tried to change it, but there was no preset theme available (that I could find) that would take me back to what I had. I tried to customize some colors but after several attempts, I just gave up and went back to 88.01. I have four Core I7 machines and one older quad core. Firefox is my default browser on all of them. Settings are the same on all of them. The problem with going back was all my settings on this machine were lost (going back by downloading and installing the older version was like a new install). I had to go back and redo my security settings and cookie controls including blocked and allowed sites.

When 89.01 was released, I upgraded a machine that I do not use as much as the two in my home office. Same result. 89.02.....same result. Why should I have to jump through hoops to get back to what I had (and what I like and am used to). I changed nothing. I have attached two screenshots. One is from the upgraded machine (with 89.02) and the other is from this one (with 88.01). Same page. Different looks. Identical settings within Firefox.

I see nothing in color customization about the menu bar. But again, why should I have to jump through hoops to get back what I had when my settings stayed the same?

let currentTab;


function StartCrawling(rootURL) { 

   currentTab = browser.tabs.create({ url: rootURL }).then(page => OnPageLoad(page), error => OnPageError(error));

}


function OnPageLoad(loadedPage) { 

   console.log(loadedPage);

}

function OnPageError(error) { 

   console.log(error);

}

I think loadedPage is a tabs.Tab object but because of javascript's nature I'm not sure. Can I get the HTML from a tabs.Tab object?

title: Firefox alt text appears while loading image
content:
On Firefox if you refresh a page you'll see the alt text appearing while an image is loading.

You can see it just on this Mozilla page (check the first image).

This doesn't happen on Chrome and other modern browsers.

I find an old issue on Bugzilla but it results as Fixed.

On that topic I find this pseudo solution (also here on Stack)

img:-moz-loading { 

 visibility: hidden;

} that works very well but as says the documentation it's non-standard:

Non-standard This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.

Any solutions?

Notice: I won't consider solutions like color: transparent or similar, that hide the alt text to users, as it's needed.

content:

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.youtube.com because this web site requires a secure connection. title: Is there a way to launch userscripts directly from browser (Firefox)?
content:
I would like to run some userscripts to backup data.

The same scripts could be used on a variety of websites. Scripts are basically the same, only some configuration changes from one script to another (what to scrape on the page, and where to save it). Scripts will not alter the page in any way, just read it then call some REST API with the data I do not want these scripts to be loaded on every web page, as they won't alter them, and depending on the page there is only one I'd like to run anyway.

So is there a way to launch these scripts directly from the browser (Firefox) ? From a bookmark or something ? Basically I want to click a button and have the script run like if I was running it from the js console.

Best I found for now is the "@run-at context-menu" directive of Tampermonkey. My script appears in a TamperMonkey context menu and is run on click.

However this menu is loaded on every page (@run-at context-menu ignores the @include directive and is applied everywhere), I'm not sure of the performance consequences, and it might be inconvenient if I end up with lots of scripts.

I guess I could also modify my scripts to be run on specific pages so that they add a floating button or something. But I'd rather not modify the pages, and it would be inconvenient on pages where I'd like to have several possible scripts.

I remember using a Greasemonkey script that added options on the context menu a long while ago. Would that be possible with Tampermonkey, implementing an equivalent of the @run-at context-menu myself that would only work on some pages ?

A more native way would be best, but I'm open to options.

title: Determining whether `contextmenu` command actually opened a context menu
content:
I have a web extension which has a listener for context menu events

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/contextmenu_event

This event is fired when the user tries to open a context menu (usually by right-clicking) on some element. But for the event to be fired, it is not necessary that any (dom-based) context menu actually opens (you'll usually see some context menu, but it may be application/system level and not related to the dom).

Is there any way to determine programmatically whether a context menu actually opened?
creator: shanali35k

title: Chrome input autofill values not getting transition style as the user typed input
content:
In the form I have been creating, I styled it when there is focus, the input font-size increases and without the focus, it decreases with 1s transition.

And when auto completing the values, I styled the autocomplete values using the valuable tips from the posts which were for, styling the filled value and styling the input background.

But when the input is filled with the auto complete and when there is no focus, the font-size decreases but the transition doesn't work.

Although It work as expected in Mozilla.

here is the css

//basic input style

input { 

   background-color: inherit;    border: none;    caret-color: red;    color: red;    transition: font-size 1s;    font-size: 1rem;

}


//auto fill input background

input:-webkit-autofill, input:-webkit-autofill:hover, input:-webkit-autofill:focus, input:-webkit-autofill:active { 

   -webkit-background-clip: text;    -webkit-box-shadow: 0 0 0 30px white inset !important;    -webkit-text-fill-color: white !important;    -webkit-background-size: 0;    -webkit-border-radius: 0;

}


//increase autofill value font-size when selecting the value

input:-webkit-autofill:focus::first-line { 

   font-size: 2rem;    font-family: 'Roboto', sans-serif !important;

}


//decrease autofill value font-size when no focus

input:-webkit-autofill:not(:focus)::first-line { 

   font-size: 1rem;

} If you didn't get what my error is, I added the Mozilla expected behavior and Chrome behavior. Sorry for the links, my gif was too big to upload here.

Can someone point out the correct code for doing it, I appreciate it.
creator: khawarali1032

title: FCM not working with Firefox in windows, android (messaging/internal-error)
content:
I am using FCM (Firebase Cloud Messaging) to send notifications for a web app. It is working fine with chrome, opera, brave in all platforms (windows, android, ubuntu). Chrome and firefox are working fine in macOS. But notifications to firefox is not working in windows and android platforms but working on macOS, ubuntu. When I tried to debug the error, firebase gave a response with

code: "messaging/internal-error" In firebase docs, they suggested to use exponential backoff to handle this type of internal errors. Tried by keeping 20 retries, But nothing worked. I am using

admin.messaging().sendToDevice(token, payload) to send messages. Tried using firebase console, not worked.
creator: nomankhan9m2

title: Noioso e frequentissimo problema nella sezione Preferenze > Ricerca > motori di ricerca
content: Come da oggetto, rilevo da svariato periodo un noioso fenomeno di inserimento NON RICHIESTO di Yahoo quale motore di ricerca predefinito, predefinito da chi? nonostante abbia eliminato nelle preferenze tutti i motori di ricerca, mantenendo esclusivamente quello di Google, tale preferenza depennata non viene mantenuta al lungo cone da screenshot allegato, saltuariamente all'apertura del browser, si presenta la preferenza del browser predefinito e quella di Google entrambe depennate, ma come motore di ricerca automatico si presenta Yahoo. Come posso risolvere definitivamente il noioso problema? Software: Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.5. Versione di Mozilla Firefox vedi screenshot allegato.
creator: paolomalaguti

title: proton v89
content:
v89 made the FoE browser game (HTML5) UI very slow. setting browser.proton.enabled to false restored old fast UI response instantly.

This is therefore very definitely an issue with v89.

Trying to log this as an issue with v89 this is only place found so far.
creator: david.osguthorpe

title: Search results says Phrase not found whenit shouldbe found
content:
I have noticed since Firefox 89.0.2 that when I press Ctrl-F to search a page it seems to work for a while but eventually stops working resulting in Phrase not found - but I know the phase is on the page.

I think if I restart my system it works sometimes for a while and later quits working but don't know how many times it works before it quits or what happens to make it quit working but it doesn't last long.

I have already done all the clear caches, history etc. and think if I totally restart my system that gets it working again for a while.

If I copy/pate the same URL into Chrome and perform the same search the phrase is found every time without fail.

Since I use the search frequently I don't think it was a problem in versions before 89.0.2 or I would have noticed it.
creator: joseibarra

title: Data permission for an app negates any security update
content:
I've been proudly using Mozilla suite and then Firefox since the nineties. I completely trust Mozilla as I believe in what this organization stands for and the product works for me. I don't trust any and all third party apps that request a slue of permissions including data which means my passwords and all that I'm typing.

If an adblocker can't manage to block adds without access to all my data there is something wrong. Without naming which one, yet is recommended by Mozilla, is scanned at virus total and given thumbs up by twenty antivirus software companies except one as it is flagged for cryptomining.

There has to be tighter controls on apps that request data access which includes logins and passwords. This shouldn't be granted to any app other than a password manager or there is no point in hardening security protocols in the core program since the damage is already done internally.
creator: zorgfromorg

title: I would like to "RUN" downloads rather than "SAVE" every time. Is that possible?
content: When I want to run an executable program I have a problem. Under IE, you have the option to RUN or Save. I have no option to RUN the program and must save it to file. Are my settings wrong or can this be fixed? I do NOT always want to SAVE the program. HELP!
creator: akshay.patil

title: "Open with" stopped working, only "download" is possible for downloadable files.
content:
A few months ago, probably after FF update, the "open with" stopped working, only download is possible.

Particularly, simple url links fail to "open with" including reading with firefox itself. I can not open PDFs, outer program links. Only a few PDF links are opened at specially crafted websites. Probably those are sites with on-site defined MIME or allowing the PDF contents being pre-cashed.

In all the other cases where the file being opened should be pre-downloaded with FF downloader, it fails to download. The same file is downloaded easily when choosing "save as"

I guess, the problem may be in the "downloader" part only, since other online contents are displayed, i.e. streamed, or stored in cache without problems.
creator: Hale

title: Duck duck go returns PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
content:
If I type a search term into the address bar, or type duckduckgo.com into the address bar, I get a long delay and then:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to duckduckgo.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Other sites (google.com) respond instantly, but who wants that?
creator: mike438

title: Set password for Firefox
content: hi, developer Firefox I would like to thank you for the awesome works you have made in 'Firefox' to me, I have used 'Firefox' for along years ago it's the best browser I've been used at all but I always ask why 'Firefox' don't have an option to prevent the browser from open until the user enters the password I think it's more secure if it will be offered in the new version please take this issue into considering
creator: islmfx
